resources.string: Configuration of your first OctoPrint profile

Printoid will guide you in the creation and the configuration of your first OctoPrint profile in the application.\n\n It is very easy and will only take you a few minutes. Please read and follow all the instructions carefully.
Give a name and set a picture to this profile to identify it easily in the app.
Please provide a valid profile name
The local IP address (or hostname) allows Printoid to connect to your OctoPrint server from your local network.\n Provide a port value only and only if you have changed the default one (80).
Please provide a valid IP (or hostname)

The public IP address (or hostname) allows Printoid to connect to your OctoPrint server over the Internet (\'outside\' of your network).\n Please follow this tutorial before trying to access to your server over the 3G/4G, for example.

Printoid needs the OctoPrint API key to connect to your server.\n The API key can be found in the settings of your OctoPrint web interface, in the menu \'API\'. The \'Enable\' checkbox has to be checked.
Please provide your OctoPrint API key
In order to instantiate the connection with your 3D printer, please provide its baudrate.\n This can be easily changed if you have more than one 3D printer connected.
Provide your Basic Authentication credentials if you have enabled this feature in your server.\n Read this page for more information.
Enable this option only if communication with HTTPS (SSL/TLS) has been enabled in your server.

Provide your SSH credentials if you want to send SSH commands to your server.\n Read this page for more information about SSH commands.\n Provide a public port for distant SSH only (by default, port 22 is used locally)
You are almost done!\nPlease review your configuration and double check all the values you have provided.
